Overview#

Voting methods are defined as follows:

@vm(name="Voting Method Name")
def name_of_voting_method(edata, curr_cands=None):
    # edata can be a Profile, ProfileWithTies, MajorityGraph, and/or MarginGraph
    # if curr_cands is not None, restrict the election to curr_cands
    # voting methods return a sorted list of candidates

The decorator vm adds the following attribute and methods to a voting method:

  1. .name: The Human-readable name of the voting method

  2. .display: Display the winners

  3. .choose: Choose a random winner from the set of winners

  4. .set_name: set the name of the voting method.

For instance, the voting method plurality() can be used as follows:

from pref_voting.profiles import Profile
from pref_voting.scoring_methods import plurality

cmap = {0:"a", 1:"b", 2:"c", 3:"d"}

prof = Profile([[0, 1, 2, 3], [2, 0, 1, 3], [1, 3, 0, 2], [3, 1, 0, 2]], [3, 2, 3, 1])

prof.display()

print(plurality.name)
print(plurality(prof))
print(plurality(prof, curr_cands = [2, 3]))
print(plurality.choose(prof))
plurality.display(prof)
plurality.display(prof, cmap = cmap)

+---+---+---+---+
| 3 | 2 | 3 | 1 |
+---+---+---+---+
| 0 | 2 | 1 | 3 |
| 1 | 0 | 3 | 1 |
| 2 | 1 | 0 | 0 |
| 3 | 3 | 2 | 2 |
+---+---+---+---+
Plurality
[0, 1]
[2]
1
Plurality winners are {0, 1}
Plurality winners are {a, b}

VotingMethod Class#

class pref_voting.voting_method.VotingMethod(vm, name=None)[source]#

A class to add functionality to voting methods.

Parameters:

  • vm (function) – An implementation of a voting method. The function should accept a Profile, ProfileWithTies, MajorityGraph, and/or MarginGraph, and a keyword parameter curr_cands to find the winner after restricting to curr_cands.

  • name (string) – The Human-readable name of the voting method.

choose(edata, curr_cands=None)[source]#

Return a randomly chosen element from the winning set.

display(edata, curr_cands=None, cmap=None, **kwargs)[source]#

Display the winning set of candidates.

set_name(new_name)[source]#

Set the name of the voting method.

pref_voting.voting_method.vm(name=None)[source]#

A decorator used when creating a voting method.

Explanations#

Voting Method

Explanation Function

Information Provided

Baldwin

baldwin()

baldwin_with_explanation()

The candidates that are eliminated and the Borda scores of the remaining candidates (in the profile restricted to candidates that have not been eliminated)

Banks

banks()

banks_with_explanation()

The maximal chains in the majority graph

Borda

borda()

Profile method: borda_scores()

The Borda score for each candidate

Bucklin

bucklin()

bucklin_with_explanation()

The score for each candidate

Coombs

coombs()

coombs_with_explanation()

The order of elimination of the candidates

Copeland

copeland()

Profile method: copeland_scores()

Majority/Margin Graph method: copeland_scores()

The Copeland score for each candidate.

Instant Runoff

instant_runoff()

instant_runoff_with_explanation()

The order of elimination of the candidates

Iterated Removal of Condorcet Losers

iterated_removal_cl()

iterated_removal_cl_with_explanation()

The order of elimination of the candidates

Llull

llull()

Profile method: copeland_scores()

Majority/Margin Graph method: copeland_scores()

use score=(1, 0.5, 0)

The Llull score for each candidate.

Minimax

minimax()

minimax_scores()

The minimax score for each candidate

Plurality

plurality()

Profile method: plurality_scores()

The Plurality score for each candidate

Simplified Bucklin

simplified_bucklin()

simplified_bucklin_with_explanation()

The score for each candidate

Strict Nanson

strict_nanson()

strict_nanson_with_explanation()

The order of elimination of the candidates and the Borda scores of the candidates (in the profile restricted to candidates that have not been eliminated)

Weak Nanson

weak_nanson()

weak_nanson_with_explanation()

The order of elimination of the candidates and the Borda scores of the candidates (in the profile restricted to candidates that have not been eliminated)

Defeat Relations#

Function

Definition

beat_path_defeat()

Returns a single networkx DiGraph. For candidates \(a\) and \(b\), a path from \(a\) to \(b\) is a sequence \(x_1, \ldots, x_n\) of distinct candidates with \(x_1=a\) and \(x_n=b\) such that for \(1\leq k\leq n-1\), \(x_k\) is majority preferred to \(x_{k+1}\). The strength of a path is the minimal margin along that path. Candidate \(a\) defeats \(b\) according to Beat Path if the the strength of the strongest path from \(a\) to \(b\) is greater than the strength of the strongest path from \(b\) to \(a\).

kemmeny_young_rankings()

Returns a list of lists of candidates. A Kemmeny-Young ranking is a ranking that minimizes the sum of the Kendall tau distances to the voters’ rankings.

ranked_pairs_defeats()

Returns a list of networkx DiGraphs. Order the edges in the margin graph from largest to smallest and lock them in in that order, skipping edges that create a cycle. If there are ties in the margins, break the ties using a tiebreaking rule (i.e., a linear ordering over the edges). Each tie-breaking rule generates a Ranked Pairs defeat relation where \(a\) defeats \(b\) if the edge from \(a\) to \(b\) in the margin graph is locked-in using the tiebreaking rule.

slater_rankings()

Returns a list of lists of candidates. A Slater ranking \(R\) is a linear order of the candidates that minimises the number of edges in the majority graph have to be turned around before to obtain \(R\).

split_cycle_defeat()

Returns a single networkx DiGraph. A majority cycle is a sequence \(x_1, \ldots ,x_n\) of distinct candidates with \(x_1=x_n\) such that for \(1 \leq k \leq n-1\), \(x_k\) is majority preferred to \(x_{k+1}\). 1. In each cycle, identify the head-to-head win(s) with the smallest margin of victory in that cycle. 2. After completing step 1 for all cycles, discard the identified wins. All remaining wins count as defeats of the losing candidates.

top_cycle_defeat()

Returns a single networkx DiGraph. Candidate \(a\) defeats candidate \(b\) when \(a\) is in the Smith Set, but \(b\) is not.

uc_gill_defeat()

Returns a single networkx DiGraph. Given candidates \(a\) and \(b\), say that \(a\) defeats \(b\) in the election if \(a\) is majority preferred to \(b\) and \(a\) left covers \(b\): i.e., for all \(c\), if \(c\) is majority preferred to \(a\), then \(c\) majority preferred to \(b\).

uc_fish_defeat()

Returns a single networkx DiGraph. Given candidates \(a\) and \(b\), say that \(a\) defeats \(b\) in the election \(a\) left covers \(b\): i.e., for all \(c\), if \(c\) is majority preferred to \(a\), then \(c\) majority preferred to \(b\).
